experiences.title: Lead Software Engineer
experiences.description:
Heading development of an Azure-powered global development dashboard featuring composite indexes and predictive models of development indicators from public data sources (UN SDGs, ND-GAIN, World Bank).

Consulting the organization to gather requirements, handle financial constraints, and ensure goal alignment.

Leading a team of 5 developers by driving code-base development, setting the development timeline, creating architecture diagrams, and hosting structured weekly team meetings.

experiences.title: Security Analyst
experiences.description:
Conducting Security Operations Center (SOC) case investigations across 7 distinct client environments.

Contributing to the team knowledge-base and refining playbook procedures per each client, reducing average case turnover time by a cumulative 1 hour across all 7 client environments.

Translating open-source intelligence (OSINT) into usable KQL alert rules for Microsoft Sentinel to proactively strengthen client environment cyber-security posture.

experiences.title: VP Projects
experiences.description:
I oversee the development of four machine-learning projects.

I manage all project timelines and conduct structured weekly meetings with the PM's to discuss progress, resolve logistical challenges, and guide the direction of their projects.

The projects include:

• Driver-Drowsiness Detector (OpenCV, YOLOv8n, PyTorch)

• Toronto Condominium-Affordability Predictor (scikit-learn, LightGBM)

• Code-Similarity Detector (CodeBERT, scikit-learn)

• Video Virality Analyzer (CLIP, OpenL3, UMAP, LightGBM)

experiences.title: Security Operations Intern
experiences.description:
Investigating and resolving 8 security incident cases per day in an external client environment.

Developing and testing KQL alert rules in Microsoft Sentinel using OSINT to prepare client infrastructure for known attacks, reducing SIEM platform false-positive alert rate by 6.0%.

Conducting third-party risk management (TPRM) assessments to minimize legal risk associated with vendors.

experiences.title: Coding Tutor
experiences.description:
At Code Ninjas, I taught kids aged 7-14 how to code using Microsoft MakeCode Arcade, Scratch 3.0, Unity, and fun online games.

I also developed the curriculum for Code Ninjas' first "Future Minds" summer camp that introduces children to how AI models learn using fun online resources such as ML 4 Kids powered by IBM Watson, Scratch 3.0, and more!

Outside of the 7 weeks of summer camps I led, I also helped children as a coding tutor in the Code Ninjas classes.

experiences.title: IT Intern
experiences.description:
Developing a Bash agent remotely gathering WELL clinic device analytics and logs into Microsoft Azure to centralize device logs, improving digital visibility of 7 WELL clinics.

Maintaining security compliance documents to protect sensitive patient medical data under industry standards.
